body.p: uses the TeX hyphenation dictionaries converted to XML by the OFFO project: .
The .xml files allow you to access the licensing terms and you can use them as a starting point to create customized dictionaries (see ).
The .hyp files are the compiled dictionaries that the actually uses.
The hyphenation dictionaries are located in: [CHEMISTRY_INSTALL_DIR]/config/hyph.
The hyphenation dictionaries are located in: [OPE_INSTALL_DIR]/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css/lib/oxygen-pdf-chemistry/config/hyph.

One simple way to add more dictionaries:
Download and extract the offo-hyphenation-compiled.zip file. This file is a bundle of many dictionary files.
Copy the fop-hyph.jar file to the [CHEMISTRY_INSTALL_DIR]/lib directory.
Copy the fop-hyph.jar file to the [OPE_INSTALL_DIR]/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css/lib/oxygen-pdf-chemistry/lib [DITA_OT_DIR]/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css/lib/oxygen-pdf-chemistry/lib directory.
Copy the fop-hyph.jar file to the [OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR]/lib directory.
If you just need a single dictionary, place the .hyp or .xml file extracted from the above jar in the [CHEMISTRY_INSTALL_DIR]/config/hyph directory, or in another directory and use the -hyph-dir parameter.
If you just need a single dictionary, place the .hyp or .xml file in the [OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR]/config/hyph directory (create that directory if it is missing).
If you just need a single dictionary, place the .hyp or .xml file in the [OPE_INSTALL_DIR]/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css/lib/oxygen-pdf-chemistry/config/hyph [DITA_OT_DIR]/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css/lib/oxygen-pdf-chemistry/config/hyph directory.
